data.title: The Godfather Part II Locations
data.meta_description: The Godfather Part II locations list with spot information and geo coordinates. View the locations of The Godfather Part II on map.
data.text:
The Godfather Part II is an American crime drama movie produced and directed by Francis Ford Coppola, written by Mario Puzo and Coppola, based on the novel by Puzo. Starring Al Pacino, Robert De Niro, Robert Duvall, Diane Keaton, John Cazale, Talia Shire, Lee Strasberg, and Richard Bright, it is both sequel and prequel to The Godfather. The film was released on December 20, 1974 (United States), earned $88 million worldwide, and won 6 Oscars including "Best Picture", "Best Director", and "Best Writing, Screenplay Adapted From Other Material". The Godfather Part II was shot in Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic; Sicily, Italy; Lake Tahoe, California; and New York City, New York, USA.

Forza d'Agrò. Photo by Luca N on Unsplash.

Where was The Godfather Part II Filmed?

The Godfather Part II was filmed in 7B Horseshoe Bar aka Vazacs, Av. Mella, Calle Duarte, Calle Hostos, East Village, El Embajador, a Royal Hideaway Hotel, Fanucci Residence, Fleur Du Lac Estates Association (Corleone Compound), Forza d'Agrò, Greenwich Village, Hospital Padre Billini, Hyman Roth Residence, Lake Tahoe, Las Vegas, Manhattan, Miami, Parque Independencia, Riva Nazario Sauro, Santo Domingo and Tomkin's Square Park.

The complete list of the locations with latitude and longitude coordinates are listed below in the table.
